instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A: Looking for correct sch.
threads.message:
Hello

I have this board, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, that's not powering up. Believe i've found the issue, or at least some of the issues. The client somehow ripped a bunch of components from the board i'm assuming during removal. Anyway, the boardview that i have, though it's for this part number, seems to be slightly different from the actual board. See pics. Does anyone have the correct board view they can help with. 

[ATTACH]59283[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59282[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A: Looking for correct sch.
threads.message:
Very sorry, I have the same boardview.
Try to see if these components have contact with some chip, or transistor, which can be more easy to locate in boardview.
